citations.narrative:
The facility is conducting regulated activity without a valid USDA license (license expiration 20-April-2024). The facility has
engaged in exhibition of covered species as recently as 25-August-2024. There are approximately 16 animals that have
been identified today that would require a USDA license for exhibition.
Failure to obtain the required license with USDA prevents the Secretary from determining compliance with the Animal
Welfare Act to ensure humane treatment of covered animals. No person shall operate as a dealer, exhibitor, or operator
of an auction sale, without a valid license.
Correct by discontinuing covered activity until a USDA License has been obtained.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two animals at the facility were found to be in need of veterinary care.
*A domestic pig had excessively overgrown hoofs that were curling outward. There were no signs of pain present when
the hoofs were manipulated, and the animal was ambulatory. Additionally, there was no swelling or redness around the
base of the hoof.
*A Salmon-Crested Cockatoo had excessively overgrown nails that curled inward nearly touching the skin of the toes. The
facility trimmed the nails of this animal at the time of inspection.
Failure to address veterinary care regarding hoof/nail trimming can result in discomfort in the animals, abnormal gait, and
possible infection. Additionally, that care is provided for all animals in the facility in accordance with direction provided by
the Attending Veterinarian.
Correct by ensuring that appropriate methods are used to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
Additionally, all animals must be treated in accordance with the direction of the Attending Veterinarian.

The facility is not currently maintaining records of animals on hand. Complete and accurate records are necessary to
facilitate the tracking of animals and maintain compliance with other aspects of the AWA. Every dealer shall make, keep,
and maintain records or forms which fully disclose the information concerning animals, purchased or otherwise acquired,
owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold,
euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 26-October-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
